subject: Brett Says Goodbye
event:
So Brett Favre is retiring.

A sad day for the cheeseheads... and for football fans everywhere, no matter what team they root for.  Brett was a class act, and one of the all time greats at his position.  He will be missed.  A great, great career.

And just think.  If it hadn't been for those damned Atlanta Falcons, he would have been a Jet.  Sigh.  "Broadway Brett."  Okay, okay, almost only counts in horseshoes and grenades, but a boy can dream.

Goodbye, Brett.

comments.article: So I'm a HUGE Cal Fan and I have to say that I am VERY happy to hear this as I really want to see Aaron Rodgers have a successful career.
Did you see Aaron Rodgers playing against Dallas?  Green Bay will be better than ever next year.

I'm a Viking fan so I despise anything that resembles a cheesehead, but Brett was the one exception. He's the only great player that probably would still would have played even if he was getting paid minimum wage. And his toughness was unparalleled, no matter what you did to him he always came back when you thought he was down for the count. Kinda like Sandor Clegane... except Favre didn't look like a monster.

Also, he showed up in the media just enough to show that he won't sell himself for a product he doesn't care about (*cough* Manning brothers *cough*). I think the only product I saw him advertising for this past year was Levi's jeans.

Plus, he was in There's Something About Mary, which was just awesome the first time you saw it. "But what about Brett Fav...rah?"

Vikings: Welcome to a few years of pounding new starting QB Aaron Rodgers :)

You'll be missed, Brett Fav...rah.

Admit it, we Viking fans are thrilled that #4 is retiring. And we won't believe it or sleep well until the first kickoff in September. He was great. He caused us great and grievous woe. We rejoice in Packer fan blues today.

But we don't need to pretend he was a gunslinger in whom the love of the game burned more brightly. If so, he would not have held Green Bay fans hostage every winter with his school-girl flirtations with retirement. He would not have bellyached through his brother and agent that he is quitting because the Packers didn't sign Randy Moss or the Packers didn't want him badly enough. He would not use mental fatigue as his excuse for hanging up the cleats. Can you imagine Terry Bradshaw or Joe Montana quitting because they were tired? Can you imagine John Elway performing Favre's an annual I-may-really-do-it-this-time dance?

Let's leave it at this: He was great and we're thrilled we won't take it on the chops from #4 anymore.
comments.subject: Schadenfreude ist die beste Freude

comments.article:
I've been a Green Bay fan since infancy, so it makes me sad to see him go. Add in the fact that I've been a resident of Mississippi since 1980, and Brett is kinda a state institution around here, and it makes it even worse.

But the more I think about it, the more I like his call in retiring now. Right now, he can walk out on top. Yeah, he did throw a REALLY bad game in the playoffs, but other than that, he was brilliant this year. He gets to step out on top; among the greats (and a definite candidate for THE GREAT) of his vaunted position. Unless something really, really dark comes up (gambling, steroids, or serial killer to name a few), he is as guaranteed a first ballot Hall of Famer as anyone has ever known.

So here's to you, Mr. Favre. Thanks for keeping the other teams of the NFC honest for all these years!

comments.upictitle: The Greatest Fucking Genius of All Time: villain
comments.article: What an amazing year he had.  I was really hoping to see him do one more.  He is quite the legend.
makes me sad...but even sadder for Madden. who will he talk about now? "if that had beem Brett Farve, he would have made the pass"...
Yeah, Madden and Terry Bradshaw have both been placed on suicide watch.
Wouldn't the last 17 years have been very different for us Raider fans if the Raiders had drafted Favre and not Todd Marinovich that year? Oh well...
Who cares about Favre...Gary Gygax is dead    :(
comments.subject: Brett Who...

comments.article: I care about Favre AND Gary. But you are right, Gary has had a slightly more lasting impact on me than Brett. That said I will miss seeing Brett on Sundays.
comments.subject: Re: Brett Who...

comments.article: Yeah, as a Vikings fan, he's a "hated" rival, but I'm sorry to see him go.  He ranks right up there with Walter Payton as one of those players whose love for the game was not only a joy to watch, but it elevated the game of everyone around him.  Even when he was kicking Minnesota's ass, it was hard not to like the guy.

yep... Favre will be missed

sooooo... been working on the book lately?? ;)
comments.subject: A Dance With Packers

comments.article: How DARE you ask about the book!
comments.subject: Re: A Dance With Packers

comments.article:
As a die-hard Bears fan, even I must admit that the loss of Brett Favre is a loss for the entire NFL.

Class act is the perfect description for Brett - he is one of those rare exceptions in football that almost every fan has to respect.
As a life-long Bears fan, I echo this sentiment -- and at the same time, breathe a sigh of relief.

Favre has had a good long career, for a football player, and he's earned his retirement.

Still, I'm kind of surprised to see nothing on the passing of Gary Gygax, whose work has contributed so much to the fantasy field, through inspiration and community building among sci-fi and fantasy geeks of all stripes. He was one of your generation's greats, and an inspiration to many.
I can't believe that someone who roots for the Giants, who just won the Super Bowl, is sad that they didn't get Brett Favre. Come on! :P
I know nothing about American football, but grrm wrote "he would have been a Jet", so... And I just checked on wiki, Jets and Giants are not the same team :D

I read a comment by Wolf that said that the Jets rated Favre as the top player in the draft... If only the Jets had a first round pick, he would have gone there.  I am glad he didn't and the Falcons traded him to GB.  I just hope Rodgers plays as well as Montana's replacemnt...
comments.subject: As a Jet

comments.article: No offense, but I can't imagine Brett being happy in New York. He's a small town boy.
Great career. Great guy. Not sure we'll see many more like him.
About time.
comments.subject: Glad he is gone

comments.article: An amazing career from a player who earned the respect of his team, opposition, and the fans.  I was glad that he could finish his career with a great year.

Goodbye to Brett Favre... finally.

Goodbye to Gary Gygax... too soon.
All I can say is football just got a bit less interesting.
Horseshoes, hand grenades and nuclear warfare. The last one is a biggie!
See, Mr. R. R. Martin, Dreams really do come true!!!!
comments.subject: Broadway Brett!!!!!
